column4: After a recent reboot, grub fails with error 15.  The error persists through repeated attempts to reinstall grub with a live cd, as well as completely reinstalling Ubuntu (7.04).  Can anyone suggest a cause to the problem or a method of fixing it?
maybe your partition table is bad!
the drive has been reformated though...
try to check the table with some program, and then resintall Ubuntu
mhmm... k, this would be the third time i've attempted reinstalling Ubuntu though
any suggestions on programs to check the partition table?
or remove all partitions, and then start again, like i did!
Partition Magic
Acronis True Image
A full format would remove all the partitions, would it not? or does the ubuntu installer do something naughty when you tell it to format the entire drive?
No it want do
There labels
have you tried the wine support?
Just change disk label type in Gnome partitioner to dos, and it will ask you to clear all part. table!
can do BlueD
Yes with Counter!
not now, reboot first]
i havent tried it with starcraft in a long time, but it works with wc3... are you using opengl?
Its a live CD, why reboot it first?
the system is completely unbootable on its own at the moment
O, sorry
go to source forge.net
